title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'mcp'
body:
When following the instructions for the demo, after running streamlit run app.py, the browser displays this error:

Traceback
File "/Users/username/code/python/minions/.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/streamlit/runtime/scriptrunner/exec_code.py", line 121, in exec_func_with_error_handling
    result = func()
File "/Users/username/code/python/minions/.venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/streamlit/runtime/scriptrunner/script_runner.py", line 591, in code_to_exec
    exec(code, module.__dict__)
    ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
File "/Users/username/code/python/minions/app.py", line 4, in <module>
    from minions.minions_mcp import SyncMinionsMCP, MCPConfigManager
File "/Users/username/code/python/minions/minions/minions_mcp.py", line 14, in <module>
    from mcp import ClientSession, StdioServerParametersusername
author: developer-nome

comments.body:
@developer-nome please make sure to install mcp.

Run `pip install mcp`

or alternatively rerun 
```
pip install -e .
```
since `mcp` was introduced recently to the `setup.py` file.
Works now that mcp was introduced recently to the setup.py file. Thank you!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that resolves the missing 'mcp' module dependency
Instructions that can be executed within the user's existing environment
An explanation of why the dependency was missing
